content: There is no relevant information provided in the prev_chunk to summarize the curr_chunk. Loan rates for quota peanuts are reduced for the 2001, 2002, and 2003 crops. Marketing assessment extension and certain peanut quota provisions are suspended for the 2003 crops. Loan rates for quota peanuts are reduced for the 2001, 2002, and 2003 crops. Marketing assessment extension and certain peanut quota provisions are suspended for the 2003 crops. Certain sections of the law do not apply to the 2003 crops of peanuts. SEC. 2. NONRECOURSE LOANS FOR 2004 AND SUBSEQUENT CROPS OF PEANUTS. Amends the Agricultural Market Transition Act to include a new section for the Peanut Program for 2004 and subsequent crops. The Secretary will provide nonrecourse loans to peanut producers for 2004 and subsequent crops at a rate not less than 85% of the average price received for peanuts in the previous 5 years, capped at $350 per ton. The Secretary will announce the loan rate for each crop of peanuts before February 15 for the upcoming marketing year. The loan rate determined for peanuts will not be reduced for inspection, handling, or storage. Adjustments may be made for location and other factors. Loans will be administered at no net cost to the Commodity Credit Corporation. The Commodity Credit Corporation can provide peanuts for domestic edible use without cost. The Secretary will implement the program through the Corporation. Amendments repeal previous peanut price support authority. Elimination of peanut quotas for 2004 and subsequent crops of peanuts. The Agricultural Adjustment Act of 1938 is being repealed, with amendments to definitions related to corn, rice, wheat, and peanuts. Peanut quotas for 2004 and beyond are eliminated. The Agricultural Adjustment Act of 1938 is being amended to remove references to peanuts in various paragraphs, including the elimination of peanut quotas for 2004 and beyond. The Agricultural Adjustment Act of 1938 is being amended to remove references to peanuts in various paragraphs, including the elimination of peanut quotas for 2004 and beyond. The amendments involve striking references to peanuts in reports, records, and regulations. The Agricultural Adjustment Act of 1938 is amended to remove references to peanuts in various sections, including eminent domain and liability. The amendments will take effect on October 1, 2003, and will apply to the 2004 and subsequent crops of peanuts. The Agricultural Adjustment Act of 1938 is amended to remove references to peanuts in various sections. The amendments will take effect on October 1, 2003, and will apply to the 2004 and subsequent crops of peanuts. SEC. 4. PURCHASE OF PEANUTS FOR NUTRITION PROGRAMS. Section 14 of the National School Lunch Act is amended to include the purchase of peanuts for nutrition programs, defining terms like additional peanuts and covered programs. The program established under the Emergency Food Assistance Act of 1983 includes various food distribution programs such as on Indian reservations, commodity distribution, commodity supplemental food program, and nutrition programs. The Secretary shall purchase peanuts or peanut products for nutrition programs at a price not exceeding the world market price for U.S.-produced peanuts, and only buy additional peanuts. The Secretary will purchase additional peanuts for covered programs without penalties for producers or sellers. Actions will be taken to ensure an adequate supply of peanuts for the programs.
